job_description: Senior Engineer, AESA Design (Part Time, Temp) - job post Raytheon Intelligence & Space (part of Raytheon) 237 reviews El Segundo, CA 90245 Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Part-time Date Posted: 2023-03-14 Country: United States of America Location: CA323: 2000 E Imperial Hwy Bldg R01 2000 East Imperial Highway Building R01, El Segundo, CA, 90245 USA Position Role Type: Onsite Our Department 22 Strategic Business Unit at Raytheon Intelligence & Space has an immediate, temporary opportunity for a part-time, Senior Engineer with expertise in AESA Design. The ideal candidate will use their expertise in Transit/Receive (T/R) module and AESA design experience to ensure CONOPS, architecture, and requirements align with customer objectives. This onsite position will be based in El Segundo, CA. Responsibilities: Responsibility for mentoring junior and mid-career engineers in hardware design and IRAD. Serve as primary interface with Raytheon Module Factory to develop components and hardware designs to meet program cost and performance requirements. Engagement across the product life cycle development contributing to the subsystem design, development, integration and test integral to technical reviews and root cause analysis teams for subsystem and components. Provides technical support and troubleshooting for multiple radar programs in production. You’re highly skilled in: Minimum 20 years’ experience in Transmit/Receive (T/R) module and AESA design Prior experience contributing to major AESA radar programs Customer interaction with Air Force, Navy, AFRL, Boeing, Northrup Grumman on AESA programs Possess strong communication and leadership skills when interfacing with customers and able to function as a technical lead. You’re a great match with: Experience mentoring and growing technical teams Experience as a T/R Module Design Lead Former experience as a Principal Investigator on IRAD projects Experience leading Engineering Departments and Cross Product Team. Published, patents - Classified documentations Education: Master’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM); PhD strongly preferred Clearance Requirements: Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain a security clearance. What’s in it for you: Raytheon Technologies ranked #2 on DefenseNews Top 100 for 2022 Flexible work schedules, possibilities for remote work Our advanced sensors, cyber services and software solutions help provide a decisive advantage to civil, military and commercial customers in more than 30 countries This is a temporary position of an undetermined length. Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. Senior Systems Engineer (El Segundo, CA) - job post Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) 181 reviews El Segundo, CA 90245 $90,000 - $200,000 a year -  Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $90,000 - $200,000 a year Job Type Part-time Description Are you a leader with expertise in systems engineering and defense development? Do you want to help insure our Nation’s preeminence in the 21st century and has safe, assured access to space? Do you like working with and improving complex systems? If so, we are looking for someone like you to join our team at APL. JHUAPL is seeking a Senior Systems Engineer to provide leadership and direction to a new, national-priority systems development program in the Space Control domain. APL, in partnership with the Government sponsor, is establishing the technical direction, performing performance analysis, and guiding the test and evaluation efforts to ensure delivery of this ground-breaking space control mission capability. The candidate will need to have demonstrated experience working with Government and Military leadership, presenting complex analysis, and ability to coordinate across a geographically dispersed team to deliver exceptional results. In addition, you will: Provide leadership to various teams working across the engineering life-cycle from concept development, requirements analysis and test evaluation. Participate as a member of the Government team to ensure the developed systems meet user needs while mitigating program risks. Provide on-site government support to ensure technical direction is developed and maintained. Identify and conduct analysis required to influence system design and assess system performance. This role is located in the sponsor facilities in El Segundo, CA Qualifications You meet our minimum qualifications for the job if you... Possess a BS in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, System Engineering, Physics, or Computer Science related disciplines. Have 5+ years of experience in a technical I position, working on system engineering, system definition, design, and development, system architecture, and/or test and evaluation. Demonstrated experience in system engineering methodologies principles, and concepts to solve systems related challenges Have working knowledge of algorithm development and or analysis using scientific programming language such as MATLAB, C++, Java, or Python. Have ability to proactively identify and develop solutions to address sponsor critical technical challenges and meet program milestones. Demonstrated ability to work in a dynamic environment that includes working with changing needs and requirements. Demonstrated excellent interpersonal skills, be able to work independently, work as a team player, and work closely with sponsors. Are comfortable and effective in communicating technical topics at all levels-to include peers, executive level management, and senior government leaders. Possess an active TS/SCI level clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. Citizenship. Can demonstrate that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. To ensure the safety and well-being of the community, APL has established a policy requiring that all staff be vaccinated against COVID-19. All staff members must provide proof of full vaccination or have an approved medical or religious accommodation by their start date. You'll go above and beyond our minimum requirements if you... Possess a MS in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, System Engineering, Physics, or Computer Science related disciplines. Have 10+ years of experience in a technical position, with experience leading a team of engineers and/or scientists, with demonstrated results. Have experience with DoD or IC organizations such as: Air Force, Army, Navy, NRO,Space Force, DNI, and others. Have extensive experience working highly classified programs. Base pay will take into account the selected candidate’s knowledge, experience, skill and/or abilities with consideration for internal parity. APL may offer bonuses or other forms of compensation per internal policy and/or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be provided in the form of a sign-on bonus, relocation benefits, locality allowance or discretionary payments for exceptional performance. APL provides a comprehensive benefits package including retirement plans, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, flexible spending accounts, part-time study and training and development. Base pay range for this role: $90,000 - $200,000. Why work at APL? The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) brings world-class expertise to our nation’s most critical defense, security, space and science challenges. While we are dedicated to solving complex challenges and pioneering new technologies, what makes us truly outstanding is our culture. We offer a vibrant, welcoming atmosphere where you can bring your authentic self to work, continue to grow, and build strong connections with inspiring teammates. At APL, we celebrate our differences and encourage creativity and bold, new ideas. Our employees enjoy generous benefits, including a robust education assistance program, unparalleled retirement contributions, and a healthy work/life balance. APL’s campus is located in the Baltimore-Washington metro area. Learn more about our career opportunities at http://www.jhuapl.edu/careers. #LI-KW1 About Us APL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, occupation, marital or familial status, political opinion, personal appearance, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. APL is committed to promoting an innovative environment that embraces diversity, encourages creativity, and supports inclusion of new ideas. In doing so, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals of all abilities, including those with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in any part of the hiring process, please contact Accommodations@jhuapl.edu. Only by ensuring that everyone’s voice is heard are we empowered to be bold, do great things, and make the world a better place.
